intro: [WRONG START] Lypertia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited lypertia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the cooler months. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies.
